summary: I haven't had many hot takes for a while cuz I'm really fuckin busy all the time but right now I'm thinking bout Caduceus and...
body:
I haven’t had many hot takes for a while cuz I’m really fuckin busy all the time but right now I’m thinking bout Caduceus and something I’d like to see is him figuring out his type.

Like he’s said he has no experience and he seems like one of those people whos like “I’ve never tried it so i have no idea if I like milk, let’s figure it out”. Although I pretty much expect romance isn’t really on his radar rn and i bet someone else would have to make the first move I am so exited for the chance of another “meeting Gilmore” situation where Caduceus rolls very high charisma and Matt decides “ok so you are exactly this npcs type and they love you now, good luck”

summary: can i just say how nice it is to see someone defending jester even without shipping f/j? it's like the whole fandom turned on...
question: can i just say how nice it is to see someone defending jester even without shipping f/j? it's like the whole fandom turned on the drop of a dime to hate her based on her relationships and seeing someone without a dog in the "oh god a ship war is brewing" race that still accepts her character flaws and thinks critically about her development was like a breath of fresh air going into the tag
answer: No problem. I understand why people can get upset about the tattoo, but she didn’t do anything bad relationship wise. People who don’t like a ship tend to see the worst even if it’s only in their heads

reblog.comment: No problem. I understand why people can get upset about the tattoo, but she didn’t do anything bad relationship wise. People who don’t like a ship tend to see the worst even if it’s only in their heads

trail.content_raw: No problem. I understand why people can get upset about the tattoo, but she didn’t do anything bad relationship wise. People who don’t like a ship tend to see the worst even if it’s only in their heads
trail.content: No problem. I understand why people can get upset about the tattoo, but she didn’t do anything bad relationship wise. People who don’t like a ship tend to see the worst even if it’s only in their heads

blog.description: Mexican 24. Journalist, writer, geek. Currently majoring in creative writing. She/Her.

summary: People hating on Jester now are probably the same people who started hating her after the money disagreement with Caleb. Like...
question: People hating on Jester now are probably the same people who started hating her after the money disagreement with Caleb. Like people have flaws and flaws lead to an interesting story
answer:
Agreed.

Flawless characters are boring. 

Sadly, female characters are often not allowed the same (or any) amount of flaws compared to their male counterpart. 

Case in point: *gestures at both CR campaigns*

blog.name: princessamericachavez
blog.title: Your Ticket to the Multiverse
blog.description: Mexican 24. Journalist, writer, geek. Currently majoring in creative writing. She/Her.

summary: I think lately we’ve seen a very interesting side of Caleb when it comes to interrogation and torture (think his albeit...
body:
I think lately we’ve seen a very interesting side of Caleb when it comes to interrogation and torture (think his albeit hilarious “buuuuut I’ll get to work if I have to” and his showing off his firebolts during their short venture into piracy last week) and it got me thinking a lot about his first instincts when it comes to these kinds of situations 

my actual main worry about Caleb is that, if anything, he seems a little too willing to jump at the call to go dark, like whenever they are playing intimidation or threatening harm, he immediately goes for the tactics that we —as an audience— know Trent forced on him… 

which is interesting knowing what Liam’s said about Caleb’s previous alignment, and the fact that he keeps describing him as “selfish” and saying the reason he wants to go and change his past is because it negatively affected him… we have no indication that Caleb was or is uncomfortable with the torture/killing tactics he used growing up… 

he is still in that absolutist “do anything it takes to get the job done” mindset, which is the same thing he told fjord that eventually lead to him sleeping with Avantika as a convenience move… and contrasts interestingly with jester’s ‘not harming anyone if we can avoid it’ and 'you don’t have to do it if you’re not comfortable with it’ advice

in many ways, it resembles Percy’s early days and just like with him, Caleb’s road to a healthy redemption will not only come from him forgiving himself for his past mistakes but also actively making an effort to grow out of those violent tendencies to become a better person and that’s gonna be so freaking interesting to see develop as the campaign goes on

reblog.comment:

my actual main worry about Caleb is that, if anything, he seems a little too willing to jump at the call to go dark, like whenever they are playing intimidation or threatening harm, he immediately goes for the tactics that we —as an audience— know Trent forced on him… 

which is interesting knowing what Liam’s said about Caleb’s previous alignment, and the fact that he keeps describing him as “selfish” and saying the reason he wants to go and change his past is because it negatively affected him… we have no indication that Caleb was or is uncomfortable with the torture/killing tactics he used growing up… 

he is still in that absolutist “do anything it takes to get the job done” mindset, which is the same thing he told fjord that eventually lead to him sleeping with Avantika as a convenience move… and contrasts interestingly with jester’s ‘not harming anyone if we can avoid it’ and 'you don’t have to do it if you’re not comfortable with it’ advice

in many ways, it resembles Percy’s early days and just like with him, Caleb’s road to a healthy redemption will not only come from him forgiving himself for his past mistakes but also actively making an effort to grow out of those violent tendencies to become a better person and that’s gonna be so freaking interesting to see develop as the campaign goes on

my actual main worry about Caleb is that, if anything, he seems a little too willing to jump at the call to go dark, like whenever they are playing intimidation or threatening harm, he immediately goes for the tactics that we —as an audience— know Trent forced on him… 

which is interesting knowing what Liam’s said about Caleb’s previous alignment, and the fact that he keeps describing him as “selfish” and saying the reason he wants to go and change his past is because it negatively affected him… we have no indication that Caleb was or is uncomfortable with the torture/killing tactics he used growing up… 

he is still in that absolutist “do anything it takes to get the job done” mindset, which is the same thing he told fjord that eventually lead to him sleeping with Avantika as a convenience move… and contrasts interestingly with jester’s ‘not harming anyone if we can avoid it’ and 'you don’t have to do it if you’re not comfortable with it’ advice

in many ways, it resembles Percy’s early days and just like with him, Caleb’s road to a healthy redemption will not only come from him forgiving himself for his past mistakes but also actively making an effort to grow out of those violent tendencies to become a better person and that’s gonna be so freaking interesting to see develop as the campaign goes on

I think lately we’ve seen a very interesting side of Caleb when it comes to interrogation and torture (think his albeit hilarious “buuuuut I’ll get to work if I have to” and his showing off his firebolts during their short venture into piracy last week) and it got me thinking a lot about his first instincts when it comes to these kinds of situations
